alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Sumner; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 12:39AM CDT until April 01 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT FOR NORTHERN DAVIDSON...CENTRAL SUMNER AND NORTHWESTERN WILSON COUNTIES... At 1238 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Goodlettsville, or 10 miles north of Nashville, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Gallatin, Lebanon, Madison, Hendersonville, Mount Juliet, Goodlettsville, White House, Millersville, Lakewood, Westmoreland, Ridgetop, Old Hickory, Green Hill, Bethpage, Bledsoe Creek State Park, Whites Creek and Cottontown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 87 and 103. Interstate 24 between mile markers 37 and 44. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for Middle Tennessee. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
